critique: This executive order pertains to the inspection of corporate income tax returns by the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System. It seems primarily concerned with the internal management of the government and the performance of governmental functions. There's no immediately obvious ideological tilt, immigration stance, or impact on civil liberties. It could be argued that allowing the Federal Reserve access to this data expands federal power slightly, and it could also be seen as a form of economic intervention, albeit a minor one. There's no clear indication of social inclusion or exclusion.
